Classes for describing the conditions of an reaction system experiment.

Exports:

T: Time, accessible anywhere through sym.Symbol(‘t’). ChemExpression: Abstract base class for classes in this module. Term: Apply a constant rate of change to a species. ConcEq: Set a species’ concentration to be exactly this equation. ConcDiffEq: Set a species’ rate of change to be exactly this equation. Conc: Define the initial concentration for a species. Schedule: Define amounts of a species to be added at a given time.

Usage:

These classes are all created with the intention of passing it into a RxnSystem. For example:

RxnSystem(

… Conc(x, 20) Schedule(y, {2: 30})

)

Use only one per species, as they don’t logically collide (You can’t fix two initial concentrations, that’s a contradiction).

class lblcrn.crn_sym.conditions.ChemExpression(symbol: sympy.core.symbol.Symbol, expression: sympy.core.expr.Expr)¶

Abstract base class for classes in this module.

It is essentially a pair of a symbol/species and an expression which conveys information about that species.

as_dict() → dict¶

Return a MSON-serializable dict representation.

classmethod from_dict(d: dict)¶

Load from a dict representation.

get_symbols() → Set[sympy.core.symbol.Symbol]¶

Get all of the symbols in the ChemExpression (except for time).

class lblcrn.crn_sym.conditions.Conc(symbol, concentration)¶

Specify the initial concentration of a symbol.

Internally, it is a schedule where the symbol gets its initial concentration added at t=0.

as_dict() → dict¶

Return a MSON-serializable dict representation.

classmethod from_dict(d: dict)¶

Load from a dict representation.

class lblcrn.crn_sym.conditions.ConcDiffEq(symbol: sympy.core.symbol.Symbol, expression: sympy.core.expr.Expr)¶

An equation for the derivative of the concentration of a species.

This guarantees that the derivative of the concentration of the symbol will always be exactly equal to the expression, regardless of what any terms dictate.

Incompatible with: CTerm, ConcEq,

class lblcrn.crn_sym.conditions.ConcEq(symbol: sympy.core.symbol.Symbol, expression: sympy.core.expr.Expr)¶

An equation for the concentration of a species.

This guarantees that the concentration of the symbol will always be exactly equal to the expression, regardless of what any terms dictate.

Incompatible with: Term, ConcDiffEq, Schedule, Conc

class lblcrn.crn_sym.conditions.Schedule(symbol: sympy.core.symbol.Symbol, schedule={})¶

A schedule describing when amounts of a species are added/removed.

symbol¶

The species the Schedule corresponds to.

as_dict() → dict¶

Return a MSON-serializable dict representation.

classmethod from_dict(d: dict)¶

Load from a dict representation.

items()¶

So that you can do schedule.items() as if it’s a dict.

class lblcrn.crn_sym.conditions.Term(symbol: sympy.core.symbol.Symbol, expression: sympy.core.expr.Expr)¶

An additive term in the ODE for a symbol.

If x’ = … + 2 and x’ = … + y*t are terms, then the ODE for x should look something like x’ … + 2 + y*t, for example.

Incompatible with: ConcEq, ConcDiffEq
